programme.title: Ultraviolet
programme.desc: Serija pod nazivom "Ultraviolet" prati život tridesetogodišnje Ole Serafin koja napušta grad u kojem živi u supruga kako bi se vratila u rodni grad gdje je svjedočila sumnjivom događaju... Kriminalistička, televizijska serija pod nazivom "Ultraviolet" donosi priču o tridesetogodišnjoj ženi Oli Serafin koja se iz Londona treba vratiti u svoj rodni grad Łódź. Jedne večeri, svjedoči jednom sumnjivom događaju koji izgleda kao pokušaj samoubojstva. Pokušava pronaći pomoć preko interneta prilikom čega nailazi na skupinu detektiva amatera koji se bave slučajevima koje policija ne rješava.

programme.title: Novak
programme.desc: Nolan se uspije obraniti od napadača bacivši ga kroz prozor nakon čega zove pojačanje. U međuvremenu, Tim, Angela i Talia pronađu Isabel, koja je ranjena u glavu. Nolan i dalje laže Westu u vezi svog... Nolan se uspije obraniti od napadača bacivši ga kroz prozor nakon čega zove pojačanje. U međuvremenu, Tim, Angela i Talia pronađu Isabel, koja je ranjena u glavu. Nolan i dalje laže Westu u vezi svog intimnog odnosa s Lucy. Ujedno je primoran ostati u uredu dok se istraga o napadu na njega ne završi. Tim, Lucy, Jackson, Angela i Talia odlazi pronaći dilera droge Vancea, koji je pucao u Isabel te je ostavio da umre. Kada ga pronađu dođe do obračuna u kojem Lucy pomogne poroditi Vanceovu djevojku.

programme.title: Novak
programme.desc: Henry Nolan u posjeti je ocu i iznenađen je što ga Jackson i Lucy znaju preko društvenih mreža. Ujutro na prozivci, Andersen obznani da će biti u patroli s Lucy, dok će Grey biti s Nolanom, a Tim s... Henry Nolan u posjeti je ocu i iznenađen je što ga Jackson i Lucy znaju preko društvenih mreža. Ujutro na prozivci, Andersen obznani da će biti u patroli s Lucy, dok će Grey biti s Nolanom, a Tim s Talijom. Neočekivano se pojavi Greyeva kći Dominique, koja traži posao stažistice. Henry i Dominique poveže strah za očeve dok obavljaju policijski posao, a Tim i Talia sukobe se oko jedne policijske procedure. Naime, oboje su prije u partnerstvu bili nadređeni novacima te nisu navikli na situaciju u kojoj su se našli.

programme.title: Novak
programme.desc: Na slobodan dan policajci su prisiljeni vratiti se na posao zbog neočekivanog dolaska potpredsjednika u Los Angeles. Nolan i Bishop zaustave muškarca koji je prijetnja potpredsjedniku te pronađu... Na slobodan dan policajci su prisiljeni vratiti se na posao zbog neočekivanog dolaska potpredsjednika u Los Angeles. Nolan i Bishop zaustave muškarca koji je prijetnja potpredsjedniku te pronađu signalni pištolj skriven u njegovom donjem rublju. Chen, pak, proživljava dramu nakon što je ubodena korištenom iglom u pokušaju razdvajanja beskućnika u tučnjavi. U međuvremenu, Lopez i West razdvajaju prosvjednike i govore onima s uvredljivim natpisima da ih spuste.

programme.title: Novak
programme.desc: Na slobodan dan policajci su prisiljeni vratiti se na posao zbog neočekivanog dolaska potpredsjednika u Los Angeles. Nolan i Bishop zaustave muškarca koji je prijetnja potpredsjedniku te pronađu... Na slobodan dan policajci su prisiljeni vratiti se na posao zbog neočekivanog dolaska potpredsjednika u Los Angeles. Nolan i Bishop zaustave muškarca koji je prijetnja potpredsjedniku te pronađu signalni pištolj skriven u njegovom donjem rublju. Chen, pak, proživljava dramu nakon što je ubodena korištenom iglom u pokušaju razdvajanja beskućnika u tučnjavi. U međuvremenu, Lopez i West razdvajaju prosvjednike i govore onima s uvredljivim natpisima da ih spuste.

programme.title: Novak
programme.desc: Večer prije Dana zaljubljenih novaci se okupe u istom baru u kojem su Grey i njegova žena. U trenutku odlaska Nolan se sukobi s muškarcem koji gnjavi ženu i kvari Greyevu večer. Na Valentinovo... Večer prije Dana zaljubljenih novaci se okupe u istom baru u kojem su Grey i njegova žena. U trenutku odlaska Nolan se sukobi s muškarcem koji gnjavi ženu i kvari Greyevu večer. Na Valentinovo Bradford uzima slobodan dan kako bi se našao sa svojom suprugom, koja je na odvikavanju. No ne ide sve po planu.

During their exploration, they soon discover they are not alone.","keywords":"abandoned city,abandoned building,chernobyl disaster,chernobyl ukraine,city name in title","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt1991245/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"markgorman"},"dateCreated":"2016-12-27","inLanguage":"English","name":"Good start but steadily gets worse and worse and worse,","reviewBody":"Interesting premise that starts really well with a sort of fly on the wall docudrama feel but steadily declines into sub prime territory. 

Six American/Australian tourists on the 'Grand Tour" find themselves in Kiev and go on an extreme tourism trip to Chernobyl and of course it all goes wrong. 

The initial set up is creepy and highly credible but when the horror starts the credibility goes out the window.

Each and every horror trope gets an outing and every bad decision (i.e. don't go into the basement) plays out, one by one.

The end result is a bit of a shambles. Disappointing.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":4}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":64690,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":5},"duration":"PT1H26M"}</script><metacontent="

poor","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt1675434/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"bakor24-1"},"dateCreated":"2011-12-28","inLanguage":"English","name":"A Film of True Humanity : Comedy in the Face of Hardship","reviewBody":"It has been 9 weeks now since Intoucblaes has come to the movie theaters. I did not give it much thought at first, but the universal acclaim I have heard convinced me to go see it. I don't over-stating the universality of the acclaim, people of various races, classes, colors & countries told me it was a must see. I had no expectations, and I was floored. 

Intouchables, directed by Eric Toledano and Olivier Nakache, starring Francois Cluzet and Omar Sy is possibly the best French movie of the year. This is not because of a lack of worthy contenders, but truly because Intouchables is that profound. It touches on themes of presumptions, social class difference, health, and as naïve as it may sound, the universality of humanity. 

The story is not as important as is the relationship that is displayed between the two protagonists. Philippe (played by Cluzet) a rich aristocrat that loves adrenaline rushes finds himself a paraplegic after a paragliding incident. Driss (played by Sy) is, in appearance a typical hoodlum from the ghetto. The two are brought together and wonders happen. 

The audience then sees how the men affect one another as they engage in a truly honest relationship. Driss is charismatic, lighthearted and funny, helping make Philippe's life enjoyable again. In the process the traditionally cold French aristocracy around Philippe warms up and lightens. He is like a hot knife through cold butter. 

Again, it is not so much the story that is important as is the social commentary. The commentary is not judgmental and is very subtle, revealed only in the contrasts the director chose in the story and its contexts. His method reminded me of a sort of Zen approach to comedy. One example you can catch from the trailer alone is the contrast between the able bodied black Driss and t the crippled white man, etc. 

The audience is also given wonderful sights of Paris and France as we go through the Pyrenees, Cabourg and the various streets of Paris. 

On paper the review does not make the movie justice. It is hilarious in a way that is true, honest and by which anyone can relate to. Most importantly it is revealing and comforting in its reminder of the essential in life : love. It's approach is simple, pure and honest and that makes it worthy of the title of "best movie of the year". 

I cannot say more; the film must be experienced. My friends tried, they failed, so I trusted them and I saw it. It floored me. Go and be floored. 

PS - I heard American studios have purchased the rights for the film. They will need a brilliant director, screenwriters and perfect actors to make the original justice in the way "The Departed" did for "Infernal Affairs".","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":9}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":782840,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":8.5},"duration":"PT1H52M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Wild Oats
Slučajne bogatašice
programme.desc: Wild Oats: Directed by Andy Tennant. With Shirley MacLaine, Jessica Lange, Demi Moore, Ptolemy Slocum. Everything changes for Eva when she receives a life insurance check accidentally made out for five million dollars instead of the expected fifty thousand dollars. She and her best friend take the money and head out for the adventure of a lifetime." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt1655461/","name":"Wild Oats","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMzE0OTcyNDExNF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwMjk5OTU4OTE@._V1_.jpg","contentRating":"PG-13","genre":["Action","Adventure","Comedy"],"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000511/","name":"Shirley MacLaine"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001448/","name":"Jessica Lange"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000193/","name":"Demi Moore"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0855035/","name":"Andy Tennant"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0366819/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0311341/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0489955/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0616673/","name":"Claudia Myers"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0437594/","name":"Gary Kanew"}],"datePublished":"2016-09-16","description":"Everything changes for Eva when she receives a life insurance check accidentally made out for five million dollars instead of the expected fifty thousand dollars. She and her best friend take the money and head out for the adventure ","keywords":"life insurance,retired teacher,spain,widow,wine","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt1655461/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"davispittman"},"dateCreated":"2016-08-27","inLanguage":"English","name":"Such a cute movie!!","reviewBody":"I just adored Wild Oats. MacLaine and Jessica are so electric when on screen together, their chemistry works so well and it is so heartwarming to see these two veteran legendary screen icons interact and be so close. Demi Moore is good here too, her supporting performance is focused and it just hits the spots that are necessary. There are so many funny lines of dialogue in this film and I loved hearing them come from the actors on screen, because they were just the right people for them, I'm glad Demi replaced SJP too, I mean I like SJP, but Demi is better in this particular role. The plot may seem trite and formulaic, and in some ways, it is, but I suggest that you actually sit down and watch this movie, it may surprise you. It was much more emotional and touching then I expected it to be, especially towards the ending. Also, it teaches great messages, it teaches messages of long term true friendship, love, coping with loss, and that you are never too old to let loose and have a little fun, age is but a number folks. 8/10 for Wild Oats, go enjoy it, it won't let ya down! Also, like the second to last scene of the movie is just sooo sweet and touching and it almost made me cry!","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":8}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":3554,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":5.7},"duration":"PT1H26M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Deep
Oto: Istraživač dubina
programme.desc:
Deep: Directed by Julio Soto Gurpide. With Justin Felbinger, Stephen Hughes, Lindsey Alena, Elisabeth Gray. In 2100, when humanity has abandoned the earth, a colony of extravagant creatures still thrives in the deepest abyss of the ocean. Deep, an adventurous "dumbo" octopus and the last one of his kind lives there with his two unconditional friends: Evo, a nerdy and clumsy angler fish, and Alice, a neurotic deep-sea shrimp. When an accident destroys their home, the guardian of the abyss, The Kraken, will send Deep and his friends on a perilous journey to find a new home. In their mission, they will be joined by Maura -a voracious moray eel- and together they will travel to amazing places like the submerged city of New York, the Titanic or the Arctic, facing formidable enemies and hilarious situations. Will they be able to bring the oceans back to their former glory?" data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt4105584/","name":"Deep","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMmQ0MWYzZjYtNGFiNS00MjE4LTliODUtMTFhOGIwMzY0ZWFmXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNjcwODQ2Nzc@._V1_.jpg","contentRating":"PG","genre":["Animation","Adventure","Comedy"],"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm7905027/","name":"Justin Felbinger"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1345076/","name":"Stephen Hughes"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2609074/","name":"Lindsey Alena"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2280443/","name":"Julio Soto Gurpide"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0265182/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0377834/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0305542/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2280443/","name":"Julio Soto Gurpide"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm8511628/","name":"Jose Tatay"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm4753711/","name":"Salva Rubio"}],"trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Deep","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi1759492633","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNTJlYmI0ZjAtZWNjOS00NDUxLWE0M2QtZGQ5Nzc4NWUzNzIxXkEyXkFqcGdeQXRoaXJkLXBhcnR5LXZpZGVvLXVwZGF0ZXI@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNTJlYmI0ZjAtZWNjOS00NDUxLWE0M2QtZGQ5Nzc4NWUzNzIxXkEyXkFqcGdeQXRoaXJkLXBhcnR5LXZpZGVvLXVwZGF0ZXI@._V1_.jpg","description":"Trailer 2 for Deep"},"datePublished":"2017-11-03","description":"In 2100, when humanity has abandoned the earth, a colony of extravagant creatures still thrives in the deepest abyss of the ocean. Deep, an adventurous "dumbo" octopus and the last one of his kind lives there with his two uncondition","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt4105584/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"paul_haakonsen"},"dateCreated":"2018-08-04","inLanguage":"English","name":"Good, but not outstanding...","reviewBody":"While "Deep" certainly was not an animation movie to make it to the top 10 list of animated movie, it still turned out to be entertaining enough for what it was.

While the story does have heavy underlying tones that are far too serious to be put into a children's animated movie, then it was done subtly enough so that the kids will not pick up on the fact that humans destroyed Earth. At least my 8 year old son didn't catch on to that part of the story.

It turned out that he rather enjoyed the movie, whereas I found it to be mediocre. It was the fact that everything was so predictable and scripted that sort of kept the movie from taking off and becoming more than just mediocre.

The characters in the movie were adequate, although hardly memorable. At least not memorable enough to last long after the movie has ended.

The animation itself was good, and I liked the small details they had in all the scenes, such as small pieces of debris or clutter drifting about. It really added to the sense that you were actually submerged into the depths of the oceans that had flooded the entire Earth.

"Deep" is good enough entertainment for a single viewing, but I doubt that I will ever be returning to watch it a second time around.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":5}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":1401,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":4.2},"duration":"PT1H33M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.desc: Rezervni dijelovi: Directed by Mario Kovac. With Mario Kovac. Mackye Gruber"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0044439/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0063593/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0102320/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0344259/","name":"J. As he grows up, he finds a way to remember these lost memories and a supernatural way to alter his life by reading his journal.","keywords":"butterfly effect,love,time travel,child pornography,memory","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0289879/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"glamslamking1"},"dateCreated":"2005-02-07","inLanguage":"English","name":"One good turn....","reviewBody":"This movie received WAY too many bad reviews. The only reason was to PUNK Ashton Kutcher. Say what you will, Kutcher did a fair to midland acting job here. There have been a lot worse performances on film in much better reviewed movies. I tell you, you will NOT be disappointed watching the Director's cut Alternate ending. It is a story of how one action causes a series of reactions...no matter the intentions, be careful what you wish for. This film's biggest mistake was promoting it in the horror genre. It is NOT! It is a nice dark fantasy film, nothing more, nothing less. There are 2 different endings, with 2 different meanings for me. I preferred the Alternate ending in lieu of the Theatrical ending. A great "popcorn" movie. Don't believe the (bad)Hype!","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":7}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":459099,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.6},"duration":"PT1H53M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Woman in Gold
Žena u zlatu
programme.desc:
Woman in Gold: Directed by Simon Curtis. With Helen Mirren, Ryan Reynolds, Daniel Brühl, Katie Holmes. Maria Altmann, an octogenarian Jewish refugee, takes on the Austrian government to recover artwork she believes rightfully belongs to her family." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt2404425/","name":"Woman in Gold","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTExMTUxNDQ5MjdeQTJeQWpwZ15BbWU4MDk4NTgxMzQx._V1_.jpg","contentRating":"PG-13","genre":["Biography","Drama","History"],"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000545/","name":"Helen Mirren"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0005351/","name":"Ryan Reynolds"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0117709/","name":"Daniel Brühl"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0193508/","name":"Simon Curtis"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0237790/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0103694/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0443252/","name":"Alexi Kaye Campbell"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2739175/","name":"E. Randol Schoenberg"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2721839/","name":"Maria Altmann"}],"trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Trailer #1","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi278572569","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjE3MjQ4MzMyMF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwNzMzNDUxNDE@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjE3MjQ4MzMyMF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwNzMzNDUxNDE@._V1_.jpg","description":"Sixty years after she fled Vienna during World War II, an elderly Jewish woman, Maria Altmann, starts her journey to retrieve family possessions seized by the Nazis, among them Klimt's famous painting 'The Lady in Gold'. Together with her inexperienced but plucky young lawyer Randy Schoenberg, she embarks upon a major battle which takes them all the way to the heart of the Austrian establishment and the U.S. Supreme Court, and forces her to confront difficult truths about the past along the way.
"},"datePublished":"2015-04-10","description":"Maria Altmann, an octogenarian Jewish refugee, takes on the Austrian government to recover artwork she believes rightfully belongs to her family.","keywords":"justice,austrian history,holocaust,art museum,looting","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt2404425/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"ferguson-6"},"dateCreated":"2015-03-31","inLanguage":"English","name":"Blending art, history, justice, and identity","reviewBody":"Greetings again from the darkness. The responsibility of the filmmaker when the project is "based on a true story" is elevated when the story has significant historical relevance and blends such elements as art, identity, justice and international law. Add to those the quest of a remarkable woman whose family was ripped apart by Nazi insurgents, and more than a history lesson, it becomes a poignant personal story.

Helen Mirren portrays Maria Altmann, the woman who emigrated to the United States by fleeing her Austrian homeland during World War II, and leaving behind her beloved family and all possessions. After the death of her sister, Ms. Altmann becomes aware of the family artwork stolen by the Nazi's during the invasion. This is not just any artwork, but multiple pieces from famed Austrian artist Gustav Klimt including "Portrait of Adele Bloch-Bauer". See, Adele was Maria's aunt, and the stunning piece (with gold leaf accents) has become "the Mona Lisa of Austria", while hanging for decades in the state gallery.

The story revolves around Maria's partnering with family friend and upstart attorney Randol Schoenberg (Ryan Reynolds) to take on the nation of Austria and reclaim the (extremely valuable) artwork that was seized illegally so many years ago. They are aided in their mission by an Austrian journalist (played by Daniel Bruhl) who is fighting his own demons. The seven-plus year legal saga is condensed for the big screen and we follow Maria and Randol as they meet with the Austrian art reclamation committee, a federal judge (played by the director's wife Elizabeth McGovern), the U.S. Supreme Court (Jonathan Pryce as Chief Justice), and finally a mediation committee back in Austria. But this is not really a courtroom drama it's a personal quest for justice and search for identity. What role does family roots and history play in determining who we are today? It's the age old question of past vs. present, only this is seen through the eyes of a woman who has survived what most of us can only imagine.

Director Simon Curtis (My Week with Marilyn) uses startling flashbacks (with Tatiana Maslany as the younger Maria) to provide glimpses of Maria's childhood through her marriage and subsequent escape. We get to know her family, including some scenes featuring Aunt Adele (Antje Traue), and Maria's father and uncle (Henry Goodman, Allan Corduner). We understand this family's place in society and just how dramatically they were impacted by the Nazi takeover.

Helen Mirren delivers yet another exceptional performance and manages to pull off the snappy lines without an ounce of schmaltz, while also capturing the emotional turmoil Ms. Altmann endures. Director Curtis and writer Alexi Kaye Campbell round off some of the rough edges and inject enough humor to prevent this from being the gut-wrenching process it probably was in real life. This approach makes the film, the story and the characters more relatable for most movie goers and it's quite an enjoyable look at a fascinating woman and a pretty remarkable underdog story.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":7}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":55397,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.3},"duration":"PT1H49M"}</script><metacontent="

Maria Altmann, an octogenarian Jewish refugee, takes on the Austrian government to recover artwork she believes rightfully belongs to her family." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt2404425/","name":"Woman in Gold","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTExMTUxNDQ5MjdeQTJeQWpwZ15BbWU4MDk4NTgxMzQx._V1_.jpg","contentRating":"PG-13","genre":["Biography","Drama","History"],"actor":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000545/","name":"Helen Mirren","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0005351/","name":"Ryan Reynolds","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0117709/","name":"Daniel Brühl"],"director":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0193508/","name":"Simon Curtis"],"creator":["@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0237790/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0103694/","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0443252/","name":"Alexi Kaye Campbell","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2739175/","name":"E. Randol Schoenberg","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2721839/","name":"Maria Altmann"],"trailer":"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Trailer #1","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi278572569","thumbnail":"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjE3MjQ4MzMyMF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwNzMzNDUxNDE@._V1_.jpg","thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjE3MjQ4MzMyMF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwNzMzNDUxNDE@._V1_.jpg","description":"Sixty years after she fled Vienna during World War II, an elderly Jewish woman, Maria Altmann, starts her journey to retrieve family possessions seized by the Nazis, among them Klimt's famous painting 'The Lady in Gold'. Together with her inexperienced but plucky young lawyer Randy Schoenberg, she embarks upon a major battle which takes them all the way to the heart of the Austrian establishment and the U.S. Supreme Court, and forces her to confront difficult truths about the past along the way.
","datePublished":"2015-04-10","description":"Maria Altmann, an octogenarian Jewish refugee, takes on the Austrian government to recover artwork she believes rightfully belongs to her family.","keywords":"justice,austrian history,holocaust,art museum,looting","review":"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt2404425/","author":"@type":"Person","name":"ferguson-6","dateCreated":"2015-03-31","inLanguage":"English","name":"Blending art, history, justice, and identity","reviewBody":"Greetings again from the darkness. The responsibility of the filmmaker when the project is "based on a true story" is elevated when the story has significant historical relevance and blends such elements as art, identity, justice and international law. Add to those the quest of a remarkable woman whose family was ripped apart by Nazi insurgents, and more than a history lesson, it becomes a poignant personal story.

Helen Mirren portrays Maria Altmann, the woman who emigrated to the United States by fleeing her Austrian homeland during World War II, and leaving behind her beloved family and all possessions. After the death of her sister, Ms. Altmann becomes aware of the family artwork stolen by the Nazi's during the invasion. This is not just any artwork, but multiple pieces from famed Austrian artist Gustav Klimt including "Portrait of Adele Bloch-Bauer". See, Adele was Maria's aunt, and the stunning piece (with gold leaf accents) has become "the Mona Lisa of Austria", while hanging for decades in the state gallery.

The story revolves around Maria's partnering with family friend and upstart attorney Randol Schoenberg (Ryan Reynolds) to take on the nation of Austria and reclaim the (extremely valuable) artwork that was seized illegally so many years ago. They are aided in their mission by an Austrian journalist (played by Daniel Bruhl) who is fighting his own demons. The seven-plus year legal saga is condensed for the big screen and we follow Maria and Randol as they meet with the Austrian art reclamation committee, a federal judge (played by the director's wife Elizabeth McGovern), the U.S. Supreme Court (Jonathan Pryce as Chief Justice), and finally a mediation committee back in Austria. But this is not really a courtroom drama it's a personal quest for justice and search for identity. What role does family roots and history play in determining who we are today? It's the age old question of past vs. present, only this is seen through the eyes of a woman who has survived what most of us can only imagine.

Director Simon Curtis (My Week with Marilyn) uses startling flashbacks (with Tatiana Maslany as the younger Maria) to provide glimpses of Maria's childhood through her marriage and subsequent escape. We get to know her family, including some scenes featuring Aunt Adele (Antje Traue), and Maria's father and uncle (Henry Goodman, Allan Corduner). We understand this family's place in society and just how dramatically they were impacted by the Nazi takeover.

Helen Mirren delivers yet another exceptional performance and manages to pull off the snappy lines without an ounce of schmaltz, while also capturing the emotional turmoil Ms. Altmann endures. Director Curtis and writer Alexi Kaye Campbell round off some of the rough edges and inject enough humor to prevent this from being the gut-wrenching process it probably was in real life. This approach makes the film, the story and the characters more relatable for most movie goers and it's quite an enjoyable look at a fascinating woman and a pretty remarkable underdog story.","reviewRating":"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":7,"aggregateRating":"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":55397,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.3,"duration":"PT1H49M"</script><metacontent="

Jackson"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001602/","name":"Guy Pearce"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001243/","name":"William Friedkin"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0045848/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0023400/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0194542/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0916136/","name":"Jim Webb"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0300866/","name":"Stephen Gaghan"}],"trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Rules of Engagement","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi4268596505","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZjEyNDJjNWItOTk2Ni00NzE0LWJkZjctMzUyNzllMGZjOWFhXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZjEyNDJjNWItOTk2Ni00NzE0LWJkZjctMzUyNzllMGZjOWFhXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Trailer for Rules Of Engagement"},"datePublished":"2000-04-07","description":"An attorney defends an officer on trial for ordering his troops to fire on civilians after they stormed a U.S. embassy in a Middle Eastern country.","keywords":"vietnam war veteran,the white house,suspense,violence,chanting","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0160797/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"Charlesc-5"},"dateCreated":"2000-11-24","inLanguage":"English","name":"2 stars - VERY Disappointing","reviewBody":"Performances were good yet inconsequential. My biggest problem with the film was the (REALLY FLAT) ending, which tacked on "what happened to them" titles.

THE PROBLEM IS: THE STORY ISN'T TRUE.

What was the point of having "what happened to..." this character or that character if these characters weren't real to begin with? I went to check to see if the story was true (which would have made me forgive the lead balloon ending) but surprise, it was all made up!

Good performances give it one star, and the siege on the embassy WAS a well done action sequence, giving it another star."},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":45223,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.4},"duration":"PT2H8M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.desc:
Good Night, and Good Luck.: Directed by George Clooney. With Jeff Daniels, David Strathairn, Alex Borstein, Rose Abdoo. Broadcast journalist Edward R. Murrow looks to bring down Senator Joseph McCarthy." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0433383/","name":"Good Night, and Good Luck.","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTY0NzQ2NDg2Ml5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTYwMzcwOTY2._V1_.jpg","contentRating":"PG","genre":["Biography","Drama","History"],"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000657/","name":"David Strathairn"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000123/","name":"George Clooney"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0165101/","name":"Patricia Clarkson"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000123/","name":"George Clooney"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0106448/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0005596/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0132772/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000123/","name":"George Clooney"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0381416/","name":"Grant Heslov"}],"trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Good Night, and Good Luck","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi2963931417","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BN2ExYzk3ZmYtYjQwZi00MjhkLWEzZGQtNTIzYzI3MjgxNWNhXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BN2ExYzk3ZmYtYjQwZi00MjhkLWEzZGQtNTIzYzI3MjgxNWNhXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Theatrical Trailer from Warner Independent Pictures"},"datePublished":"2005-11-04","description":"Broadcast journalist Edward R. Murrow looks to bring down Senator Joseph McCarthy.","keywords":"reporter,journalist,1950s,radio,politician","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0433383/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"jotix100"},"dateCreated":"2005-10-21","inLanguage":"English","name":"Broadcast news","reviewBody":""Good Night, and Good Luck" is the kind of film that has elicited strong opinions in the IMDb forum. In fact, most of the critics point out at the manipulation of the actual events and what they perceive as character assassination of the late Joseph McCarthy and the role he played during the "witch hunt" conducted by the late senator from Wisconsin. Whether these points are right, or wrong, in the minds of the contributors, most seem to disregard the film on that criteria, alone.

In fact, "Good Night, and Good Luck" shows a time in the American past that served as the model in the way television introduced the format in which the news was going to be shown to the country using the emerging technology to keep people informed. As such, CBS under William Paley's leadership, amassed a lot of talent and it became the yardstick in which other news programs were going to be judged against. George Clooney, in his second directorial job, recreates what he and his co-writer, Grant Heslov, thought about that period at the beginning of the era of television news.

The film has a documentary style that serves well to illustrate the story being told. Most of it occurring in the CBS studios in New York during the fifties. The crisp black and white cinematography, by Robert Elswit, gives the movie a nostalgic look to the way things were done in those days. Mr. Clooney has inserted scenes where a black jazz singer interprets some standard songs as though it might have been the next program following the actual news hour, and act as a buffer in the events being presented.

At the center of the story is Edward R. Murrow, the CBS anchor at the time. Mr. Murrow was greatly admired for his contributions during WWII and his broadcasts from London bringing commentaries about the war to America. Mr. Murrow was a giant in the field, most admired by all Americans because his integrity and the way he presented his stories, which ranged from the sublime, to the ridiculous, as it is the case with the interview with Liberace in Sherman Oaks where he asked the entertainer about his future wedding plans. 

The strong cast assembled for the film is excellent. David Strathairn, one of our most versatile actors plays the leading role. His take on Murrow's mannerisms and the way he spoke to his audience in front of the camera is captured with great detail. Mr. Strathairn gives a good performance, but one never really knows much about the man in the way the screen play has been written. Yes, one gets the impression of Mr. Murrow's high ethics, but as far as what made him tick, one has to wait for another biopic to find out.

The ensemble cast plays well under Mr. Clooney's direction. Robert Downey Jr., Patricia Clarkson, Ray Wise, Frank Langella, Jeff Daniels, and George Clooney are seen in the newsroom as they portray their models under Mr. Clooney's direction.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":8}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":95058,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.4},"duration":"PT1H33M"}</script><metacontent="

George Clooney, in his second directorial job, recreates what he and his co-writer, Grant Heslov, thought about that period at the beginning of the era of television news.

The film has a documentary style that serves well to illustrate the story being told. Most of it occurring in the CBS studios in New York during the fifties. The crisp black and white cinematography, by Robert Elswit, gives the movie a nostalgic look to the way things were done in those days. Mr. Clooney has inserted scenes where a black jazz singer interprets some standard songs as though it might have been the next program following the actual news hour, and act as a buffer in the events being presented.

At the center of the story is Edward R. Murrow, the CBS anchor at the time. Mr. Murrow was greatly admired for his contributions during WWII and his broadcasts from London bringing commentaries about the war to America. Mr. Murrow was a giant in the field, most admired by all Americans because his integrity and the way he presented his stories, which ranged from the sublime, to the ridiculous, as it is the case with the interview with Liberace in Sherman Oaks where he asked the entertainer about his future wedding plans. 

The strong cast assembled for the film is excellent. David Strathairn, one of our most versatile actors plays the leading role. His take on Murrow's mannerisms and the way he spoke to his audience in front of the camera is captured with great detail. Mr. Strathairn gives a good performance, but one never really knows much about the man in the way the screen play has been written. Yes, one gets the impression of Mr. Murrow's high ethics, but as far as what made him tick, one has to wait for another biopic to find out.

The ensemble cast plays well under Mr. Clooney's direction. Robert Downey Jr., Patricia Clarkson, Ray Wise, Frank Langella, Jeff Daniels, and George Clooney are seen in the newsroom as they portray their models under Mr. Clooney's direction.","reviewRating":"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":8,"aggregateRating":"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":95058,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.4,"duration":"PT1H33M"</script><metacontent="

Titus Welliver is the perfect Bosch, the rest of the cast are just as brilliant and the writing and production are both spot on. The story line is in fact two Bosch books woven into one and it has been done very cleverly. Bosch fans have been waiting for twenty years for this character to be put onto film but for me, it was worth the wait. I would dearly love to see this made into a complete series. Titus Welliver is as brilliant as always and has the tormented look behind his eyes that any Bosch fan would expect to see. He may not physically resemble Harry but that is soon forgotten. Banda je pod povećalom glavnog inspektora Chestera Campbella kojeg je poslao Winston Churchill da očisti Belfast od IRA-e, komunista, raznih bandi i običnih kriminalaca. An L.A.P.D. homicide detective works to solve the murder of a thirteen-year-old boy while standing trial in federal court for the murder of a serial killer." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"TVSeries","url":"/title/tt3502248/","name":"Bosch","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZDBiYjg4OTgtZDg2YS00ZGIzLTk3ZWMtZWRlZDQ5M2I0MDNhXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTEyMjM2NDc2._V1_.jpg","description":"An L.A.P.D. homicide detective works to solve the murder of a thirteen-year-old boy while standing trial in federal court for the murder of a serial killer.","review":"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt3502248/","author":"@type":"Person","name":"c_l_costa","dateCreated":"2014-02-12","inLanguage":"English","name":"More please!","reviewBody":"As a huge fan of Michael Connelly's Bosch books, I was looking forward to seeing this pilot and I wasn't disappointed. Titus Welliver is the perfect Bosch, the rest of the cast are just as brilliant and the writing and production are both spot on. The story line is in fact two Bosch books woven into one and it has been done very cleverly. Bosch fans have been waiting for twenty years for this character to be put onto film but for me, it was worth the wait. I would dearly love to see this made into a complete series. Titus Welliver is as brilliant as always and has the tormented look behind his eyes that any Bosch fan would expect to see. He may not physically resemble Harry but that is soon forgotten. Watch, enjoy, rate and share!","reviewRating":"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":10,"aggregateRating":"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":56837,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":8.4,"contentRating":"TV-MA","genre":["Crime","Drama"],"datePublished":"2014-02-06","keywords":"father daughter relationship,homicide detective,police procedural,police detective,based on novel","actor":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0920038/","name":"Titus Welliver","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0373100/","name":"Jamie Hector","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0032628/","name":"Amy Aquino"],"creator":["@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0483993/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0420833/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0319272/","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0653899/","name":"Eric Ellis Overmyer"],"trailer":"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Watch the Trailer","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi3258368025","thumbnail":"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNGU4MWFhMWYtMjdmNi00ZDNkLWI4NWMtNWJiNjBlYjFkMmU3XkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg","thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNGU4MWFhMWYtMjdmNi00ZDNkLWI4NWMtNWJiNjBlYjFkMmU3XkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg","description":""</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Psycho Goreman
Psiho Goreman
programme.desc:
Psycho Goreman: Directed by Steven Kostanski. With Nita-Josee Hanna, Owen Myre, Matthew Ninaber, Steven Vlahos. After unearthing a gem that controls an evil monster looking to destroy the Universe, a young girl and her brother use it to make him do their bidding." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt11252440/","name":"Psycho Goreman","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BOWNiMDUwYmUtZjJjNy00OTA5LThkM2QtODBkNTY2MGYyZGRlXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMDM2NDM2MQ@@._V1_.jpg","contentRating":"Not Rated","genre":["Comedy","Horror","Sci-Fi"],"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm9930181/","name":"Nita-Josee Hanna"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm9242868/","name":"Owen Myre"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm4078217/","name":"Matthew Ninaber"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2725627/","name":"Steven Kostanski"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0441163/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0305404/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2725627/","name":"Steven Kostanski"}],"trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Official Trailer","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi36290841","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYmUwMWRkMzktODk5My00NGM1LWFmNDUtNDcwMGI1YWI1MjI2XkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYmUwMWRkMzktODk5My00NGM1LWFmNDUtNDcwMGI1YWI1MjI2XkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg","description":"Siblings Mimi and Luke unwittingly resurrect an ancient alien overlord who was entombed on Earth millions of years ago after a failed attempt to destroy the universe. They nickname the evil creature Psycho Goreman (or PG for short) and use the magical amulet they discovered to force him to obey their childish whims. It isn't long before PG's reappearance draws the attention of intergalactic friends and foes from across the cosmos and a rogues' gallery of alien combatants converges in small-town suburbia to battle for the fate of the galaxy."},"datePublished":"2021-01-22","description":"After unearthing a gem that controls an evil monster looking to destroy the Universe, a young girl and her brother use it to make him do their bidding.","keywords":"overalls,transform,alien,splatter","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt11252440/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"brandonwdrums"},"dateCreated":"2021-01-24","inLanguage":"English","name":"Wasted opportunity","reviewBody":"Man. I seriously wanted to love this movie but it failed on it's awesome premise mainly due to the lack of funny dialogue or situations to put the characters in and how flat out annoying it's main character Mimi is.

The Good: fun premise, the power rangers-esque costumes, Psycho Goreman's dialogue and back-story sequences.

The bad: basically everything else.

Why did they add a family drama element? Why did they make the main character so insufferable? No clue. This could be so fun and absurd, instead it's mildly entertaining at best and super annoying time-suck at worst. Watch Turbo Kid or Kung Fury instead.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":4}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":8668,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.3},"duration":"PT1H35M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Peaky Blinders
programme.desc: Oni su obitelj gangstera iz Birminghama koje vodi lukavi šef Tommy Shelby, a zovu se "Peaky Blinders". Banda je pod povećalom glavnog inspektora Chestera Campbella kojeg je poslao Winston Churchill. Oni su obitelj gangstera iz Birminghama koje vodi lukavi šef Tommy Shelby, a zovu se "Peaky Blinders". Banda je pod povećalom glavnog inspektora Chestera Campbella kojeg je poslao Winston Churchill da očisti Belfast od IRA-e, komunista, raznih bandi i običnih kriminalaca. Pogledajte kako će se nositi sa Shelbyjem koji je spreman učiniti sve kako bi proširio svoje carstvo.

movement.","keywords":"friendship,singing,bus,drinking,bar","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt8951692/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"davidgee"},"dateCreated":"2020-03-11","inLanguage":"English","name":"Sister Act without the wimples","reviewBody":"There have been a lot of movies about Choirs (and even more TV shows), so this picture is a bit short on originality - and not short enough on predictability. But it's as full of the feel-good factor as anything else in this genre and worth seeing for that alone.

Kristin Scott Thomas is pitch-perfect as the posh colonel's wife whose vision of the kind of choir they need is at odds with that of the newly-promoted sergeant-major's missus (Sharon Horgan, also spot-on).

The rehearsals and performance scenes are not as much fun as those in SISTER ACT, and the women aren't as engaging as THE CALENDAR GIRLS were, but the director, Peter Cattaneo, who gave us THE FULL MONTY in 1997, brings the same full-heartedness to this belated follow-up. Predictable or not, the widowing of one of the women is very movingly presented, and the finale in the Albert Hall should bring a tear to the flintiest eye. It brought one to mine.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":7}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":4012,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.5},"duration":"PT1H52M"}</script><metacontent="

their partners away serving in Afghanistan, a group of women on the home front form a choir and quickly find themselves at the center of a media sensation and global movement.","keywords":"friendship,singing,bus,drinking,bar","review":"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt8951692/","author":"@type":"Person","name":"davidgee","dateCreated":"2020-03-11","inLanguage":"English","name":"Sister Act without the wimples","reviewBody":"There have been a lot of movies about Choirs (and even more TV shows), so this picture is a bit short on originality - and not short enough on predictability. But it's as full of the feel-good factor as anything else in this genre and worth seeing for that alone.

Kristin Scott Thomas is pitch-perfect as the posh colonel's wife whose vision of the kind of choir they need is at odds with that of the newly-promoted sergeant-major's missus (Sharon Horgan, also spot-on).

The rehearsals and performance scenes are not as much fun as those in SISTER ACT, and the women aren't as engaging as THE CALENDAR GIRLS were, but the director, Peter Cattaneo, who gave us THE FULL MONTY in 1997, brings the same full-heartedness to this belated follow-up. Predictable or not, the widowing of one of the women is very movingly presented, and the finale in the Albert Hall should bring a tear to the flintiest eye. It brought one to mine.","reviewRating":"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":7,"aggregateRating":"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":4012,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.5,"duration":"PT1H52M"</script><metacontent="

Loved this.","reviewBody":"As a fan of mysteries (Sherlock Holmes, Poirot, Columbo, Monk, Psych.etc.) I was thrilled to see someone making a classic style whodunnit...and the cast! Figure you can't go wrong. Well I enjoyed it & while the cast all have time to shine it is Daniel Craig with his Southern drawl & especially Ana de Armas that steal the show. For anyone keeping away because they hated The Last Jedi...I agree, it was my least favourite of all the Star Wars films, but this is a well written film that was well acted and I can only hope this will inspire others to reinvigorate the murder mystery genre.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":8}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":499121,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.9},"duration":"PT2H10M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.desc:
Proof: Directed by John Madden. With Gwyneth Paltrow, Anthony Hopkins, Jake Gyllenhaal, Danny McCarthy. The daughter of a brilliant but mentally disturbed mathematician, recently deceased, tries to come to grips with her possible inheritance: his insanity. Complicating matters are one of her father's ex-students, who wants to search through his papers, and her estranged sister, who shows up to help settle his affairs." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0377107/","name":"Proof","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTMxMjM0MTY4Nl5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwMDU4MjEzMQ@@._V1_.jpg","contentRating":"PG-13","genre":["Drama","Mystery"],"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000569/","name":"Gwyneth Paltrow"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000164/","name":"Anthony Hopkins"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0204706/","name":"Hope Davis"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0006960/","name":"John Madden"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0022594/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0112971/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0071970/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1430632/","name":"David Auburn"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0589182/","name":"Rebecca Miller"}],"trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Proof (2005)","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi2095427865","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYjUyZDg1OGQtNDdlMi00OGQzLWI4MDUtOTM0YmU5MTExZTQ4XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYjUyZDg1OGQtNDdlMi00OGQzLWI4MDUtOTM0YmU5MTExZTQ4XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"CT #2 Post"},"datePublished":"2005-10-07","description":"The daughter of a brilliant but mentally disturbed mathematician, recently deceased, tries to come to grips with her possible inheritance: his insanity. Complicating matters are one of her father's ex-students, who wants to search th","keywords":"mathematician,notebook,funeral,overbearing sister,dead father","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0377107/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"galasius"},"dateCreated":"2005-09-12","inLanguage":"English","name":"Madden + Paltrow = Something Good. Proof? Proof.","reviewBody":"This film is about death, love, and mental incapacity. There are bound to be endless clichés, comparisons, and parallels drawn with Ron Howard's "A Beautiful Mind", so I won't go there.

In the end, this film is all about Gwyneth Paltrow.

She is on screen at least 80% of this film. Her character dances between mourning, anger, remorse, confusion, fear, vulnerability, sadness, and just a little bit of love. There are very dramatic changes in emotion from moment to moment, and Paltrow pulls it off brilliantly.

Sir Anthony Hopkins role, while relatively small, is crucial to the film. His performance was good, but not great. But it didn't really matter, as Proof is all about Paltrow. Hope Davis and Jake Gyllenhaal also gave solid performances, but their as with Hopkin's role were really nothing more than support Paltrow.

The biggest disappointment for me was the almost total lack of any 'real' mathematics. For a film that revolves around brilliant mathematical proofs, there's an almost painful scarcity of and real math in the film. There are shots of seemingly random equations scrawled across paper or a blackboard, and the odd conversation making reference to some known mathematical law or theorem, but I would have liked more.

IF you want a happy film, go see something else. If you want a mindless film, go see something else. If you want a typical love story, go see something else. If you want an intelligent well written and presented story of substance involving a a character experiencing a roller-coaster of emotions, Proof may be for you.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":9}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":43578,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.7},"duration":"PT1H40M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: The Four Feathers
Četiri pera
programme.desc:
The Four Feathers: Directed by Shekhar Kapur. With Wes Bentley, Mohamed Bouich, Campbell Brown, Daniel Caltagirone. A British officer resigns his post just before battle and subsequently receives four white feathers from his friends and fiancee as symbols of what they believe to be his cowardice." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0240510/","name":"The Four Feathers","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTYzOTMxNzg0MV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTYwMjQwMDQ3._V1_.jpg","contentRating":"PG-13","genre":["Action","Adventure","Drama"],"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0005132/","name":"Heath Ledger"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0004747/","name":"Wes Bentley"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0005028/","name":"Kate Hudson"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001408/","name":"Shekhar Kapur"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0023400/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0022594/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0029177/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0556571/","name":"A.E.W. Mason"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0771512/","name":"Michael Schiffer"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0024925/","name":"Hossein Amini"}],"trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"The Four Feathers","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi2549219609","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMGJhODg4Y2QtOTYyMS00YzczLTljNTgtMzdlMWVmZTM3MjU4XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMGJhODg4Y2QtOTYyMS00YzczLTljNTgtMzdlMWVmZTM3MjU4XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Theatrical Trailer from Miramax"},"datePublished":"2003-04-23","description":"A British officer resigns his post just before battle and subsequently receives four white feathers from his friends and fiancee as symbols of what they believe to be his cowardice.","keywords":"male nudity,nudity,whipping,sex,naked dead man","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0240510/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"noralee"},"dateCreated":"2005-12-22","inLanguage":"English","name":"Beautiful-Looking, Old Fashioned War Melodrama","reviewBody":""Four Feathers" reminded me of "Dances With Wolves," a beautiful try at PC reinterpretation of a soldier's role in an imperialistic war. 

While I haven't read the original novel or have seen any of the previous five filmed versions of the story and my knowledge of the history of this period is pretty much formed by movies and "Masterpiece Theatre," this is the first one done by someone born in a former British colony, director Shekhar Kapur, so I was curious to see how the natives were treated (well, more like the Pawnee than the Lakota in "Wolves").

This version also carries today's symbolic weight of Western soldiers against Muslim warriors, especially as the enemy is identified as the Mahdi -- who Osama Bin Lama proclaimed as the last glory of Islam that he aspired to replicate.

This new interpretation has Heath Ledger refusing to fight in the Sudan not because of the cowardice symbolized by the titular feathers but more in the spirit of Country Joe McDonald's view of the Viet Nam War.

I got lost a few times in the geography and rescue choreography and found Djimon Hounsou a noble African with no motivation or reason for being there whatsoever.

However, the cinematography is gorgeous and will all be lost in video. Particularly thrilling are the battle scenes, which rate up there with "Barry Lyndon." I was especially impressed that Kapur didn't keep repeating the same sight lines, as most show-off directors do about shots that must have taken hours to set up.

While crossing and re-crossing the sands didn't make a lot of sense with little explanation as to survival, the treks and fights there were lovely. 

And heck, I'm a fan of the three leads, Ledger (who looks great even in a fright wig), Wes Bentley and Kate Hudson (who mostly gets to dress up and look pretty), so I just sat back and enjoyed an old-fashioned big-screen Hollywood adventure (despite the endless chatter from the row of old ladies behind me). 

(originally written 9/21/2002)","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":7}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":33034,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.5},"duration":"PT2H12M"}</script><metacontent="

Mason","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0771512/","name":"Michael Schiffer","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0024925/","name":"Hossein Amini"],"trailer":"@type":"VideoObject","name":"The Four Feathers","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi2549219609","thumbnail":"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMGJhODg4Y2QtOTYyMS00YzczLTljNTgtMzdlMWVmZTM3MjU4XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMGJhODg4Y2QtOTYyMS00YzczLTljNTgtMzdlMWVmZTM3MjU4XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Theatrical Trailer from Miramax","datePublished":"2003-04-23","description":"A British officer resigns his post just before battle and subsequently receives four white feathers from his friends and fiancee as symbols of what they believe to be his cowardice.","keywords":"male nudity,nudity,whipping,sex,naked dead man","review":"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0240510/","author":"@type":"Person","name":"noralee","dateCreated":"2005-12-22","inLanguage":"English","name":"Beautiful-Looking, Old Fashioned War Melodrama","reviewBody":""Four Feathers" reminded me of "Dances With Wolves," a beautiful try at PC reinterpretation of a soldier's role in an imperialistic war. 

While I haven't read the original novel or have seen any of the previous five filmed versions of the story and my knowledge of the history of this period is pretty much formed by movies and "Masterpiece Theatre," this is the first one done by someone born in a former British colony, director Shekhar Kapur, so I was curious to see how the natives were treated (well, more like the Pawnee than the Lakota in "Wolves").

This version also carries today's symbolic weight of Western soldiers against Muslim warriors, especially as the enemy is identified as the Mahdi -- who Osama Bin Lama proclaimed as the last glory of Islam that he aspired to replicate.

This new interpretation has Heath Ledger refusing to fight in the Sudan not because of the cowardice symbolized by the titular feathers but more in the spirit of Country Joe McDonald's view of the Viet Nam War.

I got lost a few times in the geography and rescue choreography and found Djimon Hounsou a noble African with no motivation or reason for being there whatsoever.

However, the cinematography is gorgeous and will all be lost in video. Particularly thrilling are the battle scenes, which rate up there with "Barry Lyndon." I was especially impressed that Kapur didn't keep repeating the same sight lines, as most show-off directors do about shots that must have taken hours to set up.

While crossing and re-crossing the sands didn't make a lot of sense with little explanation as to survival, the treks and fights there were lovely. 

And heck, I'm a fan of the three leads, Ledger (who looks great even in a fright wig), Wes Bentley and Kate Hudson (who mostly gets to dress up and look pretty), so I just sat back and enjoyed an old-fashioned big-screen Hollywood adventure (despite the endless chatter from the row of old ladies behind me). 

(originally written 9/21/2002)","reviewRating":"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":7,"aggregateRating":"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":33034,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.5,"duration":"PT2H12M"</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Hatchbak Ghermez
Crveni auto
programme.desc: Directed by Ashkan Najafi. With Rastin Hajbabaee, Majid Potki, Fariba Talebi, Ali Zali. Ali lives in southern Tehran with his son. In order to please his sons love for cars, he borrows money. Just as he has gathered enough, massive inflation crosses his plans. Ali is Deeply saddened, and struggles to keep the promise.

While I haven't read the original novel or have seen any of the previous five filmed versions of the story and my knowledge of the history of this period is pretty much formed by movies and "Masterpiece Theatre," this is the first one done by someone born in a former British colony, director Shekhar Kapur, so I was curious to see how the natives were treated (well, more like the Pawnee than the Lakota in "Wolves").

This version also carries today's symbolic weight of Western soldiers against Muslim warriors, especially as the enemy is identified as the Mahdi -- who Osama Bin Lama proclaimed as the last glory of Islam that he aspired to replicate.

This new interpretation has Heath Ledger refusing to fight in the Sudan not because of the cowardice symbolized by the titular feathers but more in the spirit of Country Joe McDonald's view of the Viet Nam War.

I got lost a few times in the geography and rescue choreography and found Djimon Hounsou a noble African with no motivation or reason for being there whatsoever.

However, the cinematography is gorgeous and will all be lost in video. Particularly thrilling are the battle scenes, which rate up there with "Barry Lyndon." I was especially impressed that Kapur didn't keep repeating the same sight lines, as most show-off directors do about shots that must have taken hours to set up.

While crossing and re-crossing the sands didn't make a lot of sense with little explanation as to survival, the treks and fights there were lovely. 

And heck, I'm a fan of the three leads, Ledger (who looks great even in a fright wig), Wes Bentley and Kate Hudson (who mostly gets to dress up and look pretty), so I just sat back and enjoyed an old-fashioned big-screen Hollywood adventure (despite the endless chatter from the row of old ladies behind me).

A British officer resigns his post just before battle and subsequently receives four white feathers from his friends and fiancee as symbols of what they believe to be his cowardice." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0240510/","name":"The Four Feathers","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTYzOTMxNzg0MV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTYwMjQwMDQ3._V1_.jpg","contentRating":"PG-13","genre":["Action","Adventure","Drama"],"actor":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0005132/","name":"Heath Ledger","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0004747/","name":"Wes Bentley","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0005028/","name":"Kate Hudson"],"director":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001408/","name":"Shekhar Kapur"],"creator":["@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0023400/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0022594/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0029177/","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0556571/","name":"A.E.W. Mason","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0771512/","name":"Michael Schiffer","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0024925/","name":"Hossein Amini"],"trailer":"@type":"VideoObject","name":"The Four Feathers","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi2549219609","thumbnail":"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMGJhODg4Y2QtOTYyMS00YzczLTljNTgtMzdlMWVmZTM3MjU4XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMGJhODg4Y2QtOTYyMS00YzczLTljNTgtMzdlMWVmZTM3MjU4XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Theatrical Trailer from Miramax","datePublished":"2003-04-23","description":"A British officer resigns his post just before battle and subsequently receives four white feathers from his friends and fiancee as symbols of what they believe to be his cowardice.","keywords":"male nudity,nudity,whipping,sex,naked dead man","review":"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0240510/","author":"@type":"Person","name":"noralee","dateCreated":"2005-12-22","inLanguage":"English","name":"Beautiful-Looking, Old Fashioned War Melodrama","reviewBody":""Four Feathers" reminded me of "Dances With Wolves," a beautiful try at PC reinterpretation of a soldier's role in an imperialistic war. 

While I haven't read the original novel or have seen any of the previous five filmed versions of the story and my knowledge of the history of this period is pretty much formed by movies and "Masterpiece Theatre," this is the first one done by someone born in a former British colony, director Shekhar Kapur, so I was curious to see how the natives were treated (well, more like the Pawnee than the Lakota in "Wolves").

This version also carries today's symbolic weight of Western soldiers against Muslim warriors, especially as the enemy is identified as the Mahdi -- who Osama Bin Lama proclaimed as the last glory of Islam that he aspired to replicate.

This new interpretation has Heath Ledger refusing to fight in the Sudan not because of the cowardice symbolized by the titular feathers but more in the spirit of Country Joe McDonald's view of the Viet Nam War.

I got lost a few times in the geography and rescue choreography and found Djimon Hounsou a noble African with no motivation or reason for being there whatsoever.

However, the cinematography is gorgeous and will all be lost in video. Particularly thrilling are the battle scenes, which rate up there with "Barry Lyndon." I was especially impressed that Kapur didn't keep repeating the same sight lines, as most show-off directors do about shots that must have taken hours to set up.

While crossing and re-crossing the sands didn't make a lot of sense with little explanation as to survival, the treks and fights there were lovely. 

And heck, I'm a fan of the three leads, Ledger (who looks great even in a fright wig), Wes Bentley and Kate Hudson (who mostly gets to dress up and look pretty), so I just sat back and enjoyed an old-fashioned big-screen Hollywood adventure (despite the endless chatter from the row of old ladies behind me). 

(originally written 9/21/2002)","reviewRating":"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":7,"aggregateRating":"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":33034,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.5,"duration":"PT2H12M"</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Kynodontas
Očnjak
programme.desc: Kynodontas: Directed by Yorgos Lanthimos. With Christos Stergioglou, Michele Valley, Angeliki Papoulia, Hristos Passalis. A controlling, manipulative father locks his three adult offspring in a state of perpetual childhood by keeping them prisoner within the sprawling family compound." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt1379182/","name":"Kynodontas","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjIyOTkyMDE5N15BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwNjIwNzQwMw@@._V1_.jpg","description":"A controlling, manipulative father locks his three adult offspring in a state of perpetual childhood by keeping them prisoner within the sprawling family compound.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt1379182/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"paul2001sw-1"},"dateCreated":"2011-10-12","inLanguage":"English","name":"Very odd","reviewBody":"I must confess that I didn't understand 'Dogtooth', a film that has been billed in some quarters as a "satire"; but I fail to see what it is supposed to be satirising. A couple raise their children in isolation from society, and feed them a diet of false facts about the world; in apparent accordance with their parents' desires, the children grow up with a highly unusual set of behaviours, morals and perceptions. The false picture painted by the parents is frankly bizarre, but their offspring have no external knowledge by which to judge it. But I never got any sense of what motivates the parents to behave themselves in such a strange manner, and they seem to live a similar, fairly joyless existence to their kids. Presumably this film is meant to be about something; but to me, it just felt like a pointless oddity."},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":88744,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.2},"contentRating":"Not Rated","genre":["Drama","Thriller"],"datePublished":"2009-11-11","keywords":"overprotective father,misuse of language,isolated house,child abuse,social isolation","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"A Guide to the Films of Yorgos Lanthimos","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi998160921","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZTE0ODVhZTQtZDJlYS00NmRjLWI2ZTItODE0YTgwODhlOTllXkEyXkFqcGdeQW1hZGV0aXNj._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZTE0ODVhZTQtZDJlYS00NmRjLWI2ZTItODE0YTgwODhlOTllXkEyXkFqcGdeQW1hZGV0aXNj._V1_.jpg","description":"Awkward adults, dark humor, and absurd circumstances: Welcome to the films of Yorgos Lanthimos. From 'Dogtooth' to 'The Favourite,' we break down the auteur director's cinematic trademarks."},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1176651/","name":"Christos Stergioglou"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0885091/","name":"Michele Valley"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1465326/","name":"Angeliki Papoulia"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0487166/","name":"Yorgos Lanthimos"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0263183/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0042307/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0269933/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm3328207/","name":"Efthymis Filippou"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0487166/","name":"Yorgos Lanthimos"}],"duration":"PT1H37M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Crimson Peak
Crimson Peak
programme.desc: Crimson Peak: Directed by Guillermo del Toro. With Mia Wasikowska, Jessica Chastain, Tom Hiddleston, Charlie Hunnam. In the aftermath of a family tragedy, an aspiring author is torn between love for her childhood friend and the temptation of a mysterious outsider. Trying to escape the ghosts of her past, she is swept away to a house that breathes, bleeds - and remembers." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt2554274/","name":"Crimson Peak","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZmNkYzk3YjItOTMwYy00ZWViLWIxMTUtZDJiZmY0ZWExYjVmXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTQxNzMzNDI@._V1_.jpg","contentRating":"R","genre":["Drama","Fantasy","Horror"],"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1985859/","name":"Mia Wasikowska"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1567113/","name":"Jessica Chastain"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1089991/","name":"Tom Hiddleston"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0868219/","name":"Guillermo del Toro"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0839619/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0159111/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0868219/","name":"Guillermo del Toro"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0730422/","name":"Matthew Robbins"}],"trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"International Trailer","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi924626969","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTU1OTQ4ODgxOV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwMjUwNTAwNjE@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTU1OTQ4ODgxOV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwMjUwNTAwNjE@._V1_.jpg","description":"In the aftermath of a family tragedy, an aspiring author is torn between love for her childhood friend and the temptation of a mysterious outsider. Trying to escape the ghosts of her past, she is swept away to a house that breathes, bleeds...and remembers."},"datePublished":"2015-10-16","description":"In the aftermath of a family tragedy, an aspiring author is torn between love for her childhood friend and the temptation of a mysterious outsider. Trying to escape the ghosts of her past, she is swept away to a house that breathes, ","keywords":"incest,ghost,gothic,loss of mother,haunted mansion","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt2554274/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"Jerghal"},"dateCreated":"2015-12-26","inLanguage":"English","name":"A great film and welcome break from the jump scare flicks","reviewBody":"I was getting pretty sick of those jump-scare-there's-something-lurking-in-a-dark-corner style movies like Insidious and the Conjuring. And Guillermo Del Toro must have thought the same thing because Crimson Peak is a gorgeous looking Gothic style movie with awesomely designed sets which have an incredible amount of detail to them. This adds a great dark and brooding atmosphere to the film and alleviates the need for these aforementioned jump scares. The story is well written and has great characters played by Mia Wasikowska, Tom Hiddleston and other well cast actors. Unfortunately it got only moderate critical reviews and was also somewhat ignored by the audience in favor of Goosebumps no less. Damn kids, they ruin everything! wink emoticon\n\nBut it might get a second life in the video circuit as people might still discover this very enjoyable movie. Big thumbs up for me!","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":8}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":134687,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.5},"duration":"PT1H59M"}</script><metacontent="
